p: A recent study of fires in Australia showed that there was a higher Odds Ratio (OR) for dying in a home fire during the winter time than during the warmer seasons [ 42]. During cold months, and given a fire, the OR for death in a fire was 1.9 times higher than survival. In their work, this was not further explained, but it certainly is an indication of more severe fire development in colder weather, in line with the previously described drying potential.
